I get vanilla ice cream with strawberries and nutella, mmm mmm, just ask for it (it's not on the menu) - Oh and there's a 100 internet servers nearby so you can almost always get online for FREE = big plus
author: Jared F.

description: Great food....I love the Cole Valley Crepe or the Greek one.  I'm always a bit surprised at the pricing until I remember they come with salad and potatoes.  Of course even without, it would still be worth it I think.  The dessert crepes, and bagels are also tasty.  Good, friendly service as well, and nice atmosphere.
author: Barbs J.

description: I love breakfast and brunch...Crepes on Cole was one of the first places I had brunch when I moved to San Francisco.  Over the years, I've taken friends and out-of-town guests here.  Now, when I first saw the menu oh-so-many-years ago, my first inclination was to go with the dessert crepes - what is better first thing in the morning than fresh strawberries and whipped cream wrapped in a thin pancake?  My favorite now?  The chicken pesto crepe. I also recommend the vegetarian crepe - cheese and avocado rocks!  A fabulous Sunday is Crepes on Cole and a walk to Amoeba. Just make sure you time it so that you miss the crowds (I usually go early, right before lunch.).
author: Gail O.

description:
i've had breakfast (a goat cheese omelette) and crepes (the chicken pesto one and a nutella and banana one) here before, and i think that's enough to qualify me to say that it's mediocre yet still edible. but there are WAY better crepes out there, the crepes here was just too soggy and not crisp at all. there was way too much sauce is the chicken pesto one which made it more like eating an chicken pesto enchilada.

i realize that by giving this place 2 stars, i can't really show my face there ever again. that's okay, there are better options down the street and along haight anyway.
author: Jessica W.

description: Great location but, simply put, the crepes here are quite dull.  Given its moniker, that is not a good thing.  Go to Savor or Ti Couz instead for crepe yumminess.
author: Kimberly Q.

description: I like this place because it's all fresh. Not greasey gross. Try the french toast with real maple syrup. Brown sugar crepe is yummy. and out of the savory crepes the pesto or chix pesto or bon jour. oh yes and fresh oj and carrot juice.
author: Amanda P.

description: I really want to like this place. But, other crepe spots are much better. Nothing outstanding...crepes are decent but other food is pretty bland. I suppose the prices are good...but I don't care for fillers like potatoes to make me think I'm getting a deal.
author: K. T.

description: I really loved this place and will probably return.  It's big, friendly, has a varied menu, has a good location, popular but not too crowded.  Great people watching.
author: Aaron W.

description: I'll go in only if it's not crowded. Usually after the lunch crowd dissipates. I normally just get a crepe with ham & cheese, slather it with ketchup and chow down. And next time I go here, that's what I'll do. Nice place to sit and read a book.
author: Michael R.

description: The Greek Salad's are To Die For!  You would think I'd order a Crepe-hence the name-But each time I get a chance to visit the area, I always order the Greek Salad.  My mouth is watering just thinking about their lemony salad dressing sauce!
author: Michelle L.

description: I don't eat crepes... that may be part of the problem, but this morning I had the most bland omelette I have ever had and the potatoes they serve as a side are even more bland.  Seriously, they are just potatoes.  If you like eating what effectively amounts to a boiled potato, then you will LOVE these potatoes.  The service is usually fine.  People's complaints about the owner seem off in my experience as I have always found him friendly.  My only recommendation would be to order the crepes, which sounds like a no brainer as it's call Crepes on Cole, but it would be nice if they spent a little time trying to make the other breakfast options appealling
author: Jeff R.

description: Crepes on Cole is right down the street from me, but I usually end up going to Crepevine on Irving instead.  The food here is perfectly decent, but there's just something about Crepevine that I prefer.  Still, COC has a good selection of dinner and dessert crepes, salads, sandwiches, and breakfasty stuff depending on what you're in the mood for.
author: Leslie R.

description:
so, i promised momma that i would take her out to lunch but since i have the pup it sort of limited our choice of dining options.
we ended up here since Zazie was crazy and cafe reverie's tables were all taken.
kudos for outside tables, there's 7 tables, outside, all only for 2 people,so it kind of sucks for groups. For some reason, every time i walk by there seems to be at least one person smoking.
blech. not my cuppa tea.
i guess some people feel the same way about me bringing my dog to a cafe. anyways.

so i had a Greek crepe, momma had a Florentine, both were pretty good, come with potatoes and salad, which is nice except they put the salad sort of on top of the hot crepe which makes the greens all wilty and not very tasty.
So overall, this place is two stars with an extra for the dog-accessible aspect.  

not bad, but nothing to make a trip for if you don't live within walking distance.
author: Melody O.

description: After collecting several tons of leftover cut-up potatoes off the plates of their patrons and tossing them in the trash, you'd think the owner(s) might consider changing the side to something else or creating a new bio-fuel. Breakfast is adequate but pricer than need be and if you have kids you'll enjoy the free screaming policy :) It looks nice on the outside and I occasionally forget why I don't go there, and go there only to be reminded.
author: Stephen S.

description: Yummy crepes! A place I would say is good for having a snack while you pleasantly see the newspaper, read a book, wait for someone... And with the advantage of jumping from N-Judah Muni and you're in!
author: Javi V.

description: YUMMMMMM! Wonderful crepes and potatoes. It is good food after visiting the bars around the area.
author: Jewel N.

description: For some reason I'm on a crepe-fest during my stay out here in SF.  Definitely the best savory crepe I had. Pretty cool place, little dead and no Internet access (a shock around here :) ), but excellent crepes. Though I agree they may be a little pricey, but hey I'm used to it in NY.
author: Michael S.

description: This place is OK if you are in the area and wanting crepes. The crepes are pretty decent but the service was very slow when I went.
author: Manny C.

description: I'm a lacto-vegetarian, so I don't do eggs.  So, when my friends invited me to a gathering at this landmark eatery in Cole Valley, I was dubious as to whether I would find anything to eat.  I ordered the eggplant sandwich expecting "meh", but they really blew me out of the sky with that one.  Good food, a nice atmosphere, and friendly staff mean I'll be back.
author: Apollo L.

description: Awesome!  Really really good.  Banana walnut pancakes are a party in your mouth (if you like that sort of thing)  Huge menu and everything looks good because it actually IS really good.  Fresh squeezed juices, and great coffee drinks.  The guy that owns the place creeps me out a bit and though the service is nice, it seems like there's a new server there every time I go.  That also, I don't really like.  But the food is so good.  An awesome place to go recover from a late night!
author: Amy M.

description: They do a great job here with their crepes.   A bit busy on weekends during prime brunch time, but just fine the rest of the time.  I recommend the 'Greek Crepe' as my personal favorite.  It comes with a heathly dose of well seasoned diced, grilled potatoes and a little bit of salad as well.  If you want some coffee, I recommend you grab a cup at Tully's a 1/2 block down and then come in and order your food.  If you're looking for fresh juices, Crepes on Cole will squeeze some for you right there which is a nice bonus.  Well worth the trip.
author: Scott B.

description: The portions here are too large to finish (not a bad thing) and the crepes are thin and fluffy.  Parking is a bear obviously as this is in Cole Valley.  They have fresh squeezed juices, and ample seating.  This place is casual and perfect for a weekend brunch.  This would also be a great place to bring a laptop to and spend a morning working.  Easy access to the N line, too.
author: Nadia B.

description: I haven't had any dessert crepes here, but I really like the savory crepes.  My boyfriend and I always split a crepe because you also get a salad and potatoes, and the portions are huge.  Everything is just full of flavor and great tasting.
author: Pamela S.

description: One of my favorite brunch places in the city.  Always packed when I've been there, but with short waits for a table. Everything I've tried has been DEEElicious. I kind of wish there were more outdoor tables for nice days, but I'll live.
author: Cary M.

description: In a town with so many creperies, Crepes on Cole does little to set itself apart.  The food is good, but its very typical (think Squat and Gobble, Crepevine, etc.).  On the weekend mornings this place is a fun place to people watch, if you can get a table.  Its super busy, and parking in Cole Valley is a complete bear.  I'd recommend "N-ing" it.
author: Matthew P.

description: Very cute, wood-y, spacious interior, nice staff. Last time I had a bagel with pesto sauce and avocado and a soy au lait, and they served us FAST--very satisfying (and yummy). Conveniently located right off the N. I can't quite give in 5 stars, just because there are a lot of places like this around that are also quite good (as far as neighborhood creperies go).
author: Ramon E.

description: I liked this place a lot - good food, nice interior, friendly staff. One of the most surprising things is that coffee here is rather good too. My crepe came with sides of salad and potatoes, the portion was rather big - thanks for giving a box to-go. Cash only is not a really big problem here - across the street there is an ATM in laundromat. I liked the menu - great choice and everything is tasty and fresh. Will come back for sure.
author: Ksenia B.

description: This place is fantastic! I thought crepes were a dessert food, but not the way they make them here! My friends and I would walk down from USF as often as we could afford (not that it's expensive, but we were in college)! It's a small place and often crowded, but it's worth the wait because it's yummy. ANd then there's the potatoes that are served with the crepe--not the dessert ones, though--and the beverages. Mmm, the hot chocolate. Scoring a table near the window is fantastic because you watch the MUNI train roll by, and see the neighborhood out and about. Next time I go back to SF I will HAVe to visit Crepes on Cole, like three or four times!
author: Caryn Z.

description: This is a great egg place! That's all I really had there. They have food that works for pretty much any time in the day and the location is great.
author: Zain A.

description: This one really should be 3.5 stars.  Kind of a weird ordering system, but the crepe I had was quite good, and they did not skimp on the avocado.  The coffee was ho hum, I'd recommend getting up a cup from an somewhere else and bring it.  Condolences for the girl who was obviously spending her 1st day on the job.  Nothing sucks worse than the boss reaming you, and then telling you to go fold napkins.  Ouch.
author: Eagan I.

description: Man, they sure serve some hefty portions here.  I had the Fisherman's Wharf (salmon, havarti, spinach, capers, and dill) crepe, and despite being pretty good it was a struggle to finish it at the end.  I sorta realized that early on and didn't really bother to eat the rest of the side potatoes.  The price took me off guard a little, but given the salad and the potatoes, I guess it made sense.  I kinda wished they dropped that, since the crepe is large enough by itself, not to mention kinda heavy.  The crepe itself was pretty solid, but I thought it was slightly salty.  Still, it's probably one of the better crepes I've ever had.  The freshly squeezed OJ is awesome too!
author: William C.

description: I feel like Crepes On Cole is the best kept secret in SF. It is located on the corner of Cole and Carl, away from the tourist traps on Haight, and right off of the western portal for the N Judah. You will find the walls are paneled with wood, from the ceiling down to the floor, all around; it feels like you're in a chalet, a very cozy warm place to read, have coffee, and their famous crepes. COC stays open late to 11pm on weekdays and midnight on weekends. I recommend going at night to avoid the crowds and it is an awesome place to catch up with friends after work (a few beers on tap). You'll find very friendly genuine people working there. If you see Sam, he will make you feel right at home with his charm and charisma. Don't be smug with him; he remembers all the patrons ever stepped foot in to his place.
author: Phillip T.

description: Crepes on Cole is yummy and serves a great breakfast.  I also saw Benjamin Bratt here and he was certainly delicious to look at.
author: Joy W.

description:
Every neighborhood has it crepe/breakfast/salad place, and Cole Valley is no exception.

All the standard goods, not good, but not great. Once complaint is that while friendly, they never recognize me, even though I am there several times a week after being dropped off by the N train.

Sorry to inject my personal issues here.
author: Kaveh A.

description: Crepes on Cole will always have a special spot in my life.  As a USF student I spent several meals here with friends.  Even if it's just simple crepes and salads and the loud-ass streetcar's always rumbling by; I don't know...this place just makes me happy!
author: Chelsea J.

description: Andrew: "Wait a minute, is this just Squat and Gobble with a different name?! But Squat and Gobble SUCKS!"
author: Geronimo G.

description: Forget the crepes, go here for the salads! Okay, don't forget the crepes cause they're really good. This is one of my favorite restaurants in the whole world. I've never had anything I didn't absolutely love.
author: Allison J.

description: I like walking with my dog from the Outer Richmond thru GGC park in the AM to Crepes on Cole, so that I won't feel so guilty filling my belly with potatoes & a crepe (thank God that they added salad greens a couple of years ago instead of all potatoes)! I usually like having a spinach, mushroom crepe w/ half the amount of cheese & onions. I try to get here early on the weekends to avoid the rush of people, baby strollers, etc. I like to get in early, find a seat outside with my dog & read as much as the paper that I can.
author: M M.

description: Great crepes, soft warm chewy with sweet nutella!
author: J J.

description:
**CASH ONLY**  

the quality and consistency of the food for $10 is why i give this place 4 stars.  its not a luxurious meal or anything, but it tastes grate and will fill you up when your hungry.

breakfast and desert crepes available all day too!
author: Jason C.

description: This has quickly become one of my favorite places to grab lunch in the city!  The food is great, and the staff is very friendly.  It can get a little busy on the weekends, but I guess that's a hazard of them being as good as they are.  The prices on beer can't be beat either!
author: Mark S.

description:
A great walk in the park,  de Young  Art museum or  the conservatory of flowers, followed by a nice meal in this cole valley neighborhood crepe place could be quite refreshing.

As far as the decor and most of the menu goes, it is no different from those other crepe places, items on a blackboard in different color chalk, super-delicious banana nutela crepe..the similarity-list goes on. The reason I give it an extra star over other crepe places is it serves very good food other than crepes and the crowd is very interesting. Finally, you just can't deny Sammy's (the owner) friendly personality, he makes you feel at home. Try French toast, salads and Ahi-tuna sandwich (sometimes in the special menu).  Crowd is very entertaining and interesting: I have seen people from local running clubs to San Francisco-low-carb-diet-group flock together.
author: Kingshuk g.

description: I have friends who love the place but I'm not a big fan at all.  The crepes are okay and the prices are horrible.  I'm always disappointed when I get my food.  Not a big fan of Crepes on Cole.  There are plenty of other places to get a good crepe in the city.
author: Jonathan G.

description: I always enjoy going to places that serve crepes, and this is not my favorite one.  THe food is just okay, but, what i CANNOT stand about Crepes on Coal is that there are always FLIES all over the place.  I'm sorry, but, I like to eat my food without insects landing on it.
author: Lisa H.

description: I have been to this place roughly 20 times and I can't get beyond the Banana-Coconut pancakes and the blueberry pancakes. The pancakes are huge and they give you a large amount of the accompanying fruit (they use real fruit, not that fake, artificially flavored IHOP fruit). Every time I walk in, I plan on ordering one of their many crepe selections, but I never make it past the hotcakes. The place is super busy on the weekends, but I always manage to find a place to sit. Others will tell you that it is hard to park around the area, but if you are willing to walk a block or two, it is no problemo (great public transportation access as well). Th fresh orange juice took a bit of a step back in quality, but still worth the $$. Lattes also well done.
author: R G.

description: Frequently very crowded but the food is plain, not expensive but also not notably cheap, I would describe it as "high margin".  It has the classic Haight Ashbury restaurant ambiance: dim lighting, the color brown, scuzz and greasy fingerprints on all the surfaces, utensils, plates, etc.  I think the lameness of the other restaurants nearby allows this place to coast.  What a wasted corner.  The second star is because its still a better deal than Zazie on a weekend mid-morning, when you factor in the unbelievable crowd that accumulates up the street.
author: Eric D.

description: I ordered crepes, the crepes were ok, except they were cold. The potatoes were really oily, cold and a bit raw and felt like they were leftovers from the night before. The service was pretty bad and there is no atmosphere in this place.
author: R B.

description: This is my favorite Crepes place in SF. I live in LA and have driven up just for breakfast. I also stop in every time I am in town because of the crepes and o.j. They have an amazing menu filled with crepes and other yummy treats. Stop in if you get the chance, great place!!!
author: Portia P.

description: didn't have a crepe. my friend did, though, the cole crepe. twas alright. a bit doughy. i had the #3 bagel: feta, eggplant, pesto. pretty tastey. however, all of the above and the rest of the menu was a bit pricey. sure it's in cole valley, and sure i'm from new york and i guess sf really isn't a thrifty town. buuuut... savory crepes all almost $10? pass.
author: Fede O.

description: Good food, big portions, and a super-friendly owner.  I eat here practically every Saturday because it's the starting and ending location for the kstars running club's Saturday morning runs through Golden Gate Park (www.kstars.org).  The french toast is the best thing on the menu.  Potatoes are absolutely horrible IMO, but they are good about allowing substitutions for toast (semifreddi's, yum!) or salad (decent assorted greens from a bag).
author: Galen C.

description:
I went here on Friday at 5pm to wait for my boyfriend who called and said he was going to be 45 minutes late. 
I stepped in for a white chocolate mocha and a semifreddi's dark chocolate covered almond biscotti. being the chocolate freak that i am, this combination was so nice:) 
plus, it wasn't that crowded so i got a nice table by the window looking at the N judah waiting for my man.  
I like the atmosphere. I've tried their crepes before and they are good. especially the nutella one... :P
author: Mari K.

description: The breakfasts are below average.   They really need to improve on the terrible potatoes...  not at all tasty, and often overcooked.    The sandwiches are nothing special.   The dessert crepes are good, but how can you mess up on those?   I don't dig on the atmosphere, either.  It is anything but homey or inviting.    The times I've had the owner (or manager?) take my order he seemed totally disinterested...  his attitude reminded me of a station agent or a toll booth operator.   Though to be fair, the waitresses have always been reasonably friendly and attentive.
author: Victor S.

description:
I moved to the neighborhood five months ago and gave this place dozens of chances. In that time I've put up with the high margin on the food prices, and the inconsistent cooks (including one day when everyone that got there when the place opened had to wait for over an hour for any food because the cook was late), the severe mood swings of the staff and Sam, the raising of the prices even more, the wonderful cash-only policy that one finds in so many places in this area, and, of course, the bland, tepid, often ill-prepared food. A couple of days ago I paid almost 8.50 for french toast (two pieces of bread) and 2.25 for iced tea (bad-tasting water) that was obviously left over from the day before. No more.

By the way, the wifi people use in the restaurant isn't theirs. I don't know if anybody really knows where it comes from, but it isn't theirs- that is why it is better near the windows.
author: Arthur B.

description: great food, big portions, and the owner Sammy is a very nice guy and always thinks about customers first.
author: Fady A.

description: The staff is always helpful and friendly. The food is good and comes quickly. With 3 boys it is nice to go to a place that is flexible and understanding about kids and their picky eating.
author: Hilary P.

description: eh, the food here is alright. i drove by this place after a doctor's appt at ucsf and have been craving crepes for a while. nice staff, lots of tables and great for kids, i think the food is pretty generic. the crepes aren't that exotic, just normal american flavors, nothing too creative or fancy.
author: Tawny A.

description: i've only been here once. i ordered the Cole Valley Crepe - which conisted of: provolone cheese, onions, sun dried tomato pesto sauce, avocado, mushrooms, and spinach. it was decent. no real complaints here - other than the hair that i found on my plate - but not sure if it was mine, or my girlfriend's hair. it's a decent option, but I prefer Crepevine.
author: James J.

description: the food is good, there's plenty of seating, it's reasonably priced and the the man who is often working in the morning (who i think may be the owner) is super sweet, funny and helpful.  we go here often.
author: Vanessa V.

description: This place is everything you would expect it to be and more.  I have been here many times, and never have had a bad experience.  I like the light and windows, and the dining room size is nice so typically you can find a spot to sit down and eat.
author: Jack M.

description: pretty good breakfast spot. the potatoes tasted kinda like soap, but they do everywhere almost. the actual crepe was big n was filled with meat as i wanted. very quiet. it was a long wait though for a crepe, even though the place was practicaly empty.
author: Nikita K.

description: so i know this is a crepe place, but that's not why i love  it. i'm a student and normally i wouldn't go spend that much money on a fruit salad but i can't help it. their fruit salad is just that good! it's all i get  from there and i get at least 3 times a week, but i don't think i'll ever grow tired of it. i have tried their crepes a couple of times, which are good, but i'm not really a big crepe person. i would recommend this place to anyone who is always looking for that perfect fruit salad, because you will have to look no further!
author: Emily D.

description: Great big salads here! The salads are full meals unto themselves and packed with tasty fresh ingredients. The place can get a bit loud at peak hours, but calm and mellow off-peak. A great neighborhood joint.
author: Nan B.

description: loved my crepe here, and loved the taters and salad that came with it. service is decent, the guy behind the counter was great. it can be really crowded but we still found a table when it was packed, and when it's slower you can pop open your laptop and linger for awhile. make sure you bring cash! i'll be back again.
author: Caitlin E.

description: There is a large selection of food! You're not crowded like you are in some of the other restaurants in Cole Valley.  The service was exceptional and you have unlimited refills of coffee.  The hollandaise sauce is very lemony  with some paprika on top! The eggs were perfectly poached - slightly runny, but not too eggy.
author: Catherine M.

description: If you are looking for a great, sit down, low key breakfast, lunch or dinner, Crepes is great.  Sam and his crew do a exceptional job of using fresh ingredients and providing quick service for solide meals.  My kids love this place.  My wife and I have been grabbing quick lunches and great take out salads for dinners for 8 years.  Crepes has never failed.
author: Thomas S.

description: i had my first dinner crepe!  i have only had the sweet breakfast kind, but tonight for dinner i tried the "cole valley" crepe (without onions) which was great.  it came with salad and yummy potatoes.  it was definitely a great first crepe.  i cant speak for the atmosphere or dining experience that much, becuase we took our food to go, but the service was very prompt.
author: Carolyn B.

description: brown sugar lemon butter crepe & home fries with a soy mocha & i'm good as new again :)  a sweet morning afta spot!  i prefer this order from the counter style when i just wanna b left alone with my dining companion to quietly chat amidst mmm yums!  solid eats, varied menu to please anyone, quick kitchen & fresh squeezed juice + other fruit.
author: Heiress K.

description: I am a big fan of this place! The owner Sam is so friendly and down to Earth. He delivered our food and personally greeted us, and welcomed my wife, kids, and I to the neighborhood. The food here is good. A little pricey but I am willing to pay the extra amount for quality service....and the portions are quite generous, including a small salad or some potatoes with your sandwich. Good stuff. Check it out!
author: Rob B.

description: great breakfast place. avoid the uninspired omelettes and stick with the crepes!
author: Megan S.

description: As a crepe place in a small town, this would get a much higher rating. There is nothing *wrong* with it, and the man (owner?) behind the counter is incredibly friendly and personable. But there are so many other crepe places in this city that are much higher quality (and some less expensive, for better quality) that I don't go here unless I absolutely have to.
author: Geae D.

description: This is where you want to go for pancacakes. Absolutley the best breakfast in San Francisco if not the US.
author: Theodore C.

description: This is my go to place when I want a place to take a book, have coffee and chill over breakfast or brunch.  Perfect for a hangover too. My favorite crepe is the basil....it has basil, spinach, tomatoes, cheddar and feta cheese. But recently I tried the fruit, yogurt, granola bowl and it was delicious. It had so many different kinds of berries in it instead of having less expensive chunks of melons like many places. The owner is always very friendly too.
author: Briton C.

description: cool place, nice neighborhood.  walking distance from the haight.  pretty busy...you have to order at the counter and they give you a number, then you find a table.  worth the wait.  very yummy crepes.  i had the chicken pesto and strawberry nutella.  crepes come with a side salad, vinagrette and potatoes.  very yummy.  they also have salads, pancakes, and omlettes.  great place to hang out with friends,or bring someone on an afternoon date.  cool atmosphere.  would go again and again.
author: D W.

description: I've never had any of their savory crepes but their sweet/dessert crepes are really good.  My favorites are the strawberry and nutella with banana crepes.  The place is dark but's it pretty clean, the seats are comfortable and prices are reasonable.  The service is good - quick and friendly.  I used to come here whenever I wasn't at Cafe Reverie after school.
author: Chelsie C.

description: I live right down the street and love this place for its variety and the fact that you usually don't have to wait for a table.  The crepes are all really good and the selection is great, with lots of vegetarian options.  I also really like the omelettes, sandwiches, and salads.  It's a great option when you are looking for a quick brunch and don't want to wait forever for Zazie.  It's also open pretty early and late too if you need to eat in the off hours.  The only downside is that it's cash only.
author: Jessica R.

description: typical crepe place. i dont know what to say about it here. i have eaten breakfast here and it was pretty good. it gets really busy here too and people just hang out all day. all i know is that 40 days and 40 nights was filmed here in the beginning of the movie.
author: andree t.

description: Nice atmosphere with the chalkboard menu and what not. Fairly typical Ameri-brunch fare. Cash only.
author: A. T.

description: These don't really taste like real crepes, but they do the trick -- they are cheap and tasty.  The place is kind of depressing, for some reason.  It's not all that cozy.
author: sinclair w.

description: The food is tasty, but everytime we eat there, my husband and I get some bug in our stomach.
author: Miinno N.

description: my favorite place in the city for breakfast...you can't go wrong with building your own crepe (and they have goat cheese!!!!!)...mimosas..applewood smoked bacon...mexican hot chocolate...blueberry pancakes the size of your head..i leave full and always really happy!
author: Erin S.

description: i found this place today and i will deffininately be going back. the service was great, laura served me, she suggested the chicken pesto crepe. it was filling and tasted good. not too pricey either. They have seating outside too which is such a bonus .....specially in this heat. As io said, i'll be back, even if its just to see the servers smile.
author: Wayne T.

description: It might be crowded on the weekends and the service can sometimes be a little slow, but I've always been satisfied with my meal whether its breakfast, lunch or dinner. The portions sizes are good and the house potatoes always hit the spot. I've come here more than once when Zazie (1 block away) is too crowded for brunch.
author: Emily L.
